**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-07T12:03:42Z" title="05/07/2015 12:03  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 7, 2015</time> by Phafor**

Can you EVA them? If so, then easy to land next to them and have them walk over to the new ship.

Failing that, the [Klaw](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Advanced_Grabbing_Unit) may bail you out. Tricky job, but you could design a ship that would drop down on top of their wreckage and pick up their capsule to return home. Might have to be careful about re-entry however, if the capsule is damaged and lacks a heat shield...

Well, you could just land a rescue craft next to it (this can be a lot harder than it sounds, basically set the crashed vessel as your target and deorbit. Keep your retrograde Marker on the retro target marker and keep trying ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) and use EVA to transfer your kerbals manually. In case you don't know EVA is Extra Vehicular Activity (or sth along the lines of that) so basically let them get out and walk over to the rescue craft. However this will require the corresponding upgrade (I think it's the astronaut complex, let me check).

Edit: to EVA you will have to upgrade your astronaut complex to level two, which only costs 70k funds.

Tourists can't be EVAed, but they *can* be transferred between seats on the same vessel. 

So you won't have to transport their pods home with the klaw, just connect another ship to the pod using the claw and then transfer the tourist through the klaw into the new ship. 

\*Caveat: this worked in 0.90.0. I'm not sure whether the ability to transfer kerbals through pipes meant for fuel was patched out in 1.0
Good point, I guess I will have to try that out

The klaw has a limitation : how to get past the atmosphere.

Tourists can't EVA, but I think you can "transfert" them. So :

- Create a ship with empty seats, designed for reentry.

- Add a klaw (detachable)

- catch the brocken ship

- transfert the tourists to empty seats

- detach claw

- return Kerbin.

Sounds easy,but I bet not.

You got yourself in pretty messy situation. I would flip the switch on the tracking station and put my suit up for press conference.

Rocket was hit by class-A asteroid. NOTHING could be done to save those poor souls. Conpansation to families will be paid from contracted fees.

Will try to test if claw indeed can transfer crew. Would be strange if it could.
